byline.contributor: Monica Davey and Mitch Smith contributed reporting.

abstract: Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel announces he will return early from family vacation in Cuba following continued calls for his resignation over Chicago Police Dept's handling of police-involved fatal shootings; much of criticism is in connection city's handling of investigation into 2014 shooting death of teenager Laquan McDonald, but protests have reignited following weekend shooting of two people by Chicago police officers, one of whom died.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Emanuel, who has faced calls to resign amid an unrelenting outcry about the Police Department’s handling of fatal shootings, has cut short a family vacation and will return to the city, his office said Monday.

headline.main: Mayor Rahm Emanuel Cuts Trip to Cuba Short After Police Shooting in Chicago
headline.print_headline: Mayor Cuts Trip to Cuba Short After Police Shooting in Chicago

snippet: Mr. Emanuel, who has faced calls to resign amid an unrelenting outcry about the Police Department’s handling of fatal shootings, has cut short a family vacation and will return to the city, his office said Monday.
